result.markdown:
--- title: "Clinical Reporting with {gtsummary}" author: "Daniel D. Sjoberg" footer: "[Clinical Reporting with {gtsummary}](https://www.danieldsjoberg.com/clinical-reporting-gtsummary-rmed/)" logo: "images/gtsummary-logo.png" editor: source format: revealjs: theme: slides.scss transition: fade slide-number: true chalkboard: true execute: echo: true output: asis freeze: auto cache: true --- ## Acknowledgements ::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} This work is licensed under a [Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) (CC BY-SA4.0). ::: ::: ## Daniel D. Sjoberg ::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="60%"} ``{=html} [danieldsjoberg.com](https://www.danieldsjoberg.com/) ``{=html} [\@statistishdan](https://twitter.com/statistishdan) ``{=html} [linkedin.com/in/ddsjoberg/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ddsjoberg/) ``{=html} [github.com/ddsjoberg](https://github.com/ddsjoberg/) ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](images/dan-fire-island.jpg) ::: ::: ## Checklist
``{=html} Install recent R release Current version 4.2.1 ``{=html} Install RStudio I am on version 2022.07.1+554 ``{=html} Install packages ``` r install.packages(c("gtsummary", "tidyverse", "labelled", "usethis", "causaldata", "skimr")) ``` ``{=html} Ensure you can knit Rmarkdown files # Motivation ## Reproducibility Crisis :::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="60%"} - Quality of medical research is often low - **Low quality code** in medical research part of the problem - Low quality code is more likely to **contain errors** - Reproducibility is often **cumbersome** and **time-consuming** ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](images/reproducibility-graphic-online1.jpeg) ::: :::: ::: aside https://www.nature.com/news/1-500-scientists-lift-the-lid-on-reproducibility-1.19970 ::: ## {gtsummary} overview :::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="50%"} * Create **tabular summaries** with sensible defaults but highly customizable * Types of summaries: - "Table 1"-types - Cross-tabulation - Regression models - Survival data - Survey data - Custom tables ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} * Report statistics from {gtsummary} tables **inline** in R Markdown * Stack and/or merge any table type * Use **themes** to standardize across tables * Choose from different **print engines** ::: :::: ## Example Dataset :::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="40%"} * The `trial` data set is included with {gtsummary} * Simulated data set of baseline characteristics for 200 patients who receive Drug A or Drug B * Variables were assigned labels using the `labelled` package ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-2_ba19d2fc32bfd465d8dd8b452ae64f67'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(gtsummary) library(tidyverse) head(trial) |> gt::gt() ```
trt age marker stage grade response death ttdeath
Drug A 23 0.160 T1 II 0 0 24.00
Drug B 9 1.107 T2 I 1 0 24.00
Drug A 31 0.277 T1 II 0 0 24.00
Drug A NA 2.067 T3 III 1 1 17.64
Drug A 51 2.767 T4 III 1 1 16.43
Drug B 39 0.613 T4 I 0 1 15.64
::: ::: :::: ## Example Dataset :::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="60%"} This presentation will use a subset of the variables. ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-3_c9677dce54eeafbaf3aed3a6e924d96b'} ```{.r .cell-code} sm_trial <- trial |> select(trt, age, grade, response) ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-4_5ba24a82124f176fd9fb1e38a52675bf'}
Variable Label
trt Chemotherapy Treatment
age Age
grade Grade
response Tumor Response
::: ::: :::: # tbl_summary() ## Basic tbl_summary() ::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5_5de51c8ed0e1e0a917d41dc044e1abf6'} ```{.r .cell-code} sm_trial |> select(-trt) |> tbl_summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Characteristic N = 2001
Age 47 (38, 57)
Unknown 11
Grade
I 68 (34%)
II 68 (34%)
III 64 (32%)
Tumor Response 61 (32%)
Unknown 7
1 Median (IQR); n (%)
``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} - Four types of summaries: `continuous`, `continuous2`, `categorical`, and `dichotomous` - Statistics are `median (IQR)` for continuous, `n (%)` for categorical/dichotomous - Variables coded `0/1`, `TRUE/FALSE`, `Yes/No` treated as dichotomous - Lists `NA` values under "Unknown" - Label attributes are printed automatically ::: ::: ## Customize tbl_summary() output ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-6_247ddcdbdf453351a55220f51b4a75c8'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_summary( sm_trial, by = trt, type = age ~ "continuous2", statistic = list( age ~ c("{mean} ({sd})", "{min}, {max}"), response ~ "{n} / {N} ({p}%)" ), label = grade ~ "Pathologic tumor grade", digits = age ~ 1 ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Characteristic Drug A, N = 981 Drug B, N = 1021
Age
Mean (SD) 47.0 (14.7) 47.4 (14.0)
Range 6.0, 78.0 9.0, 83.0
Unknown 7 4
Pathologic tumor grade
I 35 (36%) 33 (32%)
II 32 (33%) 36 (35%)
III 31 (32%) 33 (32%)
Tumor Response 28 / 95 (29%) 33 / 98 (34%)
Unknown 3 4
1 n (%); n / N (%)
``` ::: ::: ::: small ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} - `by`: specifies a column variable for cross-tabulation - `type`: specifies the summary type - `statistic`: customize the reported statistics ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} - `label`: change or customize variable labels - `digits`: specify the number of decimal places for rounding ::: ::: ::: ## {gtsummary} + formulas

**Named list are OK too!** `label = list(age = "Patient Age")` ## Add-on functions in {gtsummary} `tbl_summary()` objects can also be updated using related functions. - `add_*()` add additional column of statistics or information, e.g. p-values, q-values, overall statistics, treatment differences, N obs., and more - `modify_*()` modify table headers, spanning headers, footnotes, and more - `bold_*()/italicize_*()` style labels, variable levels, significant p-values ## Update tbl_summary() with add\_\*() ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-7_26751b15962749b7e3c4d8dcfd395bb1'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="5,6"} sm_trial |> tbl_summary( by = trt ) |> add_p() |> add_q(method = "fdr") ```
Characteristic Drug A, N = 981 Drug B, N = 1021 p-value2 q-value3
Age 46 (37, 59) 48 (39, 56) 0.7 0.9
Unknown 7 4
Grade 0.9 0.9
I 35 (36%) 33 (32%)
II 32 (33%) 36 (35%)
III 31 (32%) 33 (32%)
Tumor Response 28 (29%) 33 (34%) 0.5 0.9
Unknown 3 4
1 Median (IQR); n (%)
2 Wilcoxon rank sum test; Pearson's Chi-squared test
3 False discovery rate correction for multiple testing
::: - `add_p()`: adds a column of p-values - `add_q()`: adds a column of p-values adjusted for multiple comparisons through a call to `p.adjust()` ## Update tbl_summary() with add\_\*() ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-8_75ee06f8927e504ddf623caf6714fa4c'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="12"} trial |> select(trt, marker, response) |> tbl_summary( by = trt, statistic = list(marker ~ "{mean} ({sd})", response ~ "{p}%"), missing = "no" ) |> add_difference() ```
Characteristic Drug A, N = 981 Drug B, N = 1021 Difference2 95% CI2,3 p-value2
Marker Level (ng/mL) 1.02 (0.89) 0.82 (0.83) 0.20 -0.05, 0.44 0.12
Tumor Response 29% 34% -4.2% -18%, 9.9% 0.6
1 Mean (SD); %
2 Welch Two Sample t-test; Two sample test for equality of proportions
3 CI = Confidence Interval
::: - `add_difference()`: mean and rate differences between two groups. Can also be adjusted differences ## Update tbl_summary() with add\_\*() ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-9_06fc29ec0a0a1eb8e06381a798162fa4'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="6,7,8,9,10"} sm_trial |> tbl_summary( by = trt, missing = "no" ) |> add_overall() |> add_n() |> add_stat_label( label = all_categorical() ~ "No. (%)" ) ```
Characteristic N Overall, N = 200 Drug A, N = 98 Drug B, N = 102
Age, Median (IQR) 189 47 (38, 57) 46 (37, 59) 48 (39, 56)
Grade, No. (%) 200
I 68 (34%) 35 (36%) 33 (32%)
II 68 (34%) 32 (33%) 36 (35%)
III 64 (32%) 31 (32%) 33 (32%)
Tumor Response, No. (%) 193 61 (32%) 28 (29%) 33 (34%)
::: - `add_overall()`: adds a column of overall statistics - `add_n()`: adds a column with the sample size - `add_stat_label()`: adds a description of the reported statistic ## Update tbl_summary() with add\_\*() ::: {.columns .v-center-container} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-10_53c2efc0fde5c2acc9896ed69983a71c'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="6"} sm_trial |> tbl_summary( by = trt, missing = "no" ) |> add_stat(...) ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} - Customize statistics presented with `add_stat()` - Added statistics can be placed on the label or the level rows - Added statistics may be a single column or multiple ::: ::: ## Update with bold\_\*()/italicize\_\*() ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-11_a84d64b27f8bd1602d8d1c6272a8ea4a'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="6,7,8"} sm_trial |> tbl_summary( by = trt ) |> add_p() |> bold_labels() |> italicize_levels() |> bold_p(t = 0.8) ```
Characteristic Drug A, N = 981 Drug B, N = 1021 p-value2
Age 46 (37, 59) 48 (39, 56) 0.7
Unknown 7 4
Grade 0.9
I 35 (36%) 33 (32%)
II 32 (33%) 36 (35%)
III 31 (32%) 33 (32%)
Tumor Response 28 (29%) 33 (34%) 0.5
Unknown 3 4
1 Median (IQR); n (%)
2 Wilcoxon rank sum test; Pearson's Chi-squared test
::: - `bold_labels()`: bold the variable labels - `italicize_levels()`: italicize the variable levels - `bold_p()`: bold p-values according a specified threshold ## Update tbl_summary() with modify\_\*() ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-12_48f8b6380dc3dbe701fa90eae8059388'} ```{.r .cell-code} sm_trial |> tbl_summary( by = trt, missing = "no" ) |> modify_header( stat_1 ~ "**Group A**", stat_2 ~ "**Group B**" ) |> modify_spanning_header( all_stat_cols() ~ "**Drug**") |> modify_footnote( all_stat_cols() ~ paste("median (IQR) for continuous;", "n (%) for categorical") ) ```
Characteristic Drug
Group A1 Group B1
Age 46 (37, 59) 48 (39, 56)
Grade
I 35 (36%) 33 (32%)
II 32 (33%) 36 (35%)
III 31 (32%) 33 (32%)
Tumor Response 28 (29%) 33 (34%)
1 median (IQR) for continuous; n (%) for categorical
::: - Use `show_header_names()` to see the internal header names available for use in `modify_header()` ## Add-on functions in {gtsummary} And many more! See the documentation at http://www.danieldsjoberg.com/gtsummary/reference/index.html And a detailed `tbl_summary()` vignette at http://www.danieldsjoberg.com/gtsummary/articles/tbl_summary.html ## Cross-tabulation with tbl_cross() `tbl_cross()` is a wrapper for `tbl_summary()` for **n x m** tables ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-13_bb57ae7b66815da52a8d0b05de432691'} ```{.r .cell-code} sm_trial |> tbl_cross( row = trt, col = grade, percent = "row", margin = "row" ) |> add_p(source_note = TRUE) |> bold_labels() ```
Grade
I II III
Chemotherapy Treatment
Drug A 35 (36%) 32 (33%) 31 (32%)
Drug B 33 (32%) 36 (35%) 33 (32%)
Total 68 (34%) 68 (34%) 64 (32%)
Pearson's Chi-squared test, p=0.9
::: ## Continuous Summaries with tbl_continuous() `tbl_continuous()` summarizes a continuous variable by 1, 2, or more categorical variables ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-14_51b01feb8d272ade2e80eeaa0d822c3a'} ```{.r .cell-code} sm_trial |> tbl_continuous( variable = age, by = trt, include = grade ) ```
Characteristic Drug A, N = 981 Drug B, N = 1021
Grade
I 46 (36, 60) 48 (42, 55)
II 44 (31, 54) 50 (43, 57)
III 52 (42, 60) 45 (36, 52)
1 Age: Median (IQR)
::: ## Survey data with tbl_svysummary() ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-15_a664b895c6292421f68185d7e81dea2a'} ```{.r .cell-code} survey::svydesign( ids = ~1, data = as.data.frame(Titanic), weights = ~Freq ) |> tbl_svysummary(by = Survived) |> add_p() |> modify_spanning_header( all_stat_cols() ~ "**Survived**") ```
Characteristic Survived p-value2
No, N = 1,4901 Yes, N = 7111
Class 0.7
1st 122 (8.2%) 203 (29%)
2nd 167 (11%) 118 (17%)
3rd 528 (35%) 178 (25%)
Crew 673 (45%) 212 (30%)
Sex 0.048
Male 1,364 (92%) 367 (52%)
Female 126 (8.5%) 344 (48%)
Age 0.4
Child 52 (3.5%) 57 (8.0%)
Adult 1,438 (97%) 654 (92%)
Freq 342 (140, 513) 79 (64, 144) 0.013
1 n (%); Median (IQR)
2 chi-squared test with Rao & Scott's second-order correction; Wilcoxon rank-sum test for complex survey samples
::: ## Survival outcomes with tbl_survfit() ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-16_e9f9f5f27b3c1f0f69d6c81236500bd9'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(survival) fit <- survfit(Surv(ttdeath, death) ~ trt, trial) tbl_survfit( fit, times = c(12, 24), label_header = "**{time} Month**" ) |> add_p() ```
Characteristic 12 Month 24 Month p-value1
Chemotherapy Treatment 0.2
Drug A 91% (85%, 97%) 47% (38%, 58%)
Drug B 86% (80%, 93%) 41% (33%, 52%)
1 Log-rank test
::: # tbl_regression() ## Traditional model summary() ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%" style="font-size:0.75em;font-family:monospace"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/trad-model-summary_5cf0f7efcd67deb3c6f48d0897361cc4'} ```{.r .cell-code} m1 <- glm( response ~ age + stage, data = trial, family = binomial(link = "logit") ) ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="font-size:0.5em;"} ![](images/raw-output-logistic-regression.png) ::: ::: Looks **messy** and it's not easy to digest ## Basic tbl_regression() ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-18_4d321cf4f07d886c05143296ee5ab277'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_regression(m1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Characteristic log(OR)1 95% CI1 p-value
Age 0.02 0.00, 0.04 0.091
T Stage
T1 — —
T2 -0.54 -1.4, 0.31 0.2
T3 -0.06 -1.0, 0.82 0.9
T4 -0.23 -1.1, 0.64 0.6
1 OR = Odds Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
``` ::: ::: - Displays **p-values** for covariates - Shows **reference levels** for categorical variables ## Customize tbl_regression() output ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-19_d97bb469236858ccc676c4e16b0ddfe2'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_regression( m1, exponentiate = TRUE ) |> add_global_p() |> add_glance_table( include = c(nobs, logLik, AIC, BIC) ) ```
Characteristic OR1 95% CI1 p-value
Age 1.02 1.00, 1.04 0.087
T Stage 0.6
T1 — —
T2 0.58 0.24, 1.37
T3 0.94 0.39, 2.28
T4 0.79 0.33, 1.90
No. Obs. 183
Log-likelihood -112
AIC 234
BIC 250
1 OR = Odds Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
::: - Display **odds ratio** estimates and **confidence intervals** - Add global p-values - Add various model statistics ## Supported models in tbl_regression() `biglm::bigglm()`, `biglmm::bigglm()`, `brms::brm()`, `cmprsk::crr()`, `fixest::feglm()`, `fixest::femlm()`, `fixest::feNmlm()`, `fixest::feols()`, `gam::gam()`, `geepack::geeglm()`, `glmmTMB::glmmTMB()`, `lavaan::lavaan()`, `lfe::felm()`, `lme4::glmer()`, `lme4::glmer.nb()`, `lme4::lmer()`, `MASS::glm.nb()`, `MASS::polr()`, `mgcv::gam()`, `mice::mira`, `nnet::multinom()`, `ordinal::clm()`, `ordinal::clmm()`, `parsnip::model_fit`, `plm::plm()`, `rstanarm::stan_glm()`, `stats::aov()`, `stats::glm()`, `stats::lm()`, `stats::nls()`, `survey::svycoxph()`, `survey::svyglm()`, `survey::svyolr()`, `survival::clogit()`, `survival::coxph()`, `survival::survreg()`, `tidycmprsk::crr()`, `VGAM::vglm()` **Custom tidiers** can be written and passed to `tbl_regression()` using the `tidy_fun=` argument. ## Univariate models with tbl_uvregression() ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-20_5c6af3d5ff4091cc1890cd46351d22fa'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_uvreg <- sm_trial |> tbl_uvregression( method = glm, y = response, method.args = list(family = binomial), exponentiate = TRUE ) tbl_uvreg ```
Characteristic N OR1 95% CI1 p-value
Chemotherapy Treatment 193
Drug A — —
Drug B 1.21 0.66, 2.24 0.5
Age 183 1.02 1.00, 1.04 0.10
Grade 193
I — —
II 0.95 0.45, 2.00 0.9
III 1.10 0.52, 2.29 0.8
1 OR = Odds Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
::: - Specify model `method`, `method.args`, and the `response` variable - Arguments and helper functions like `exponentiate`, `bold_*()`, `add_global_p()` can also be used with `tbl_uvregression()` # inline_text() ## {gtsummary} reporting with inline_text() - Tables are important, but we often need to report results in-line in a report. - Any statistic reported in a {gtsummary} table can be extracted and reported in-line in an R Markdown document with the `inline_text()` function. - The pattern of what is reported can be modified with the `pattern = ` argument. - Default is `pattern = "{estimate} ({conf.level*100}% CI {conf.low}, {conf.high}; {p.value})"`. ## {gtsummary} reporting with inline_text() ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-21_258ad21e0dd5fee29393921564348ac1'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Characteristic N OR1 95% CI1 p-value
Chemotherapy Treatment 193
Drug A — —
Drug B 1.21 0.66, 2.24 0.5
Age 183 1.02 1.00, 1.04 0.10
Grade 193
I — —
II 0.95 0.45, 2.00 0.9
III 1.10 0.52, 2.29 0.8
1 OR = Odds Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
``` ::: ::: **In Code:** The odds ratio for age is `` `r inline_text(tbl_uvreg, variable = age)` `` **In Report:** The odds ratio for age is 1.02 (95% CI 1.00, 1.04; p=0.10) # tbl_merge()/tbl_stack() ## tbl_merge() for side-by-side tables ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} A **univariable** table: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-22_318bc783cd202853ddab6cf0c5c3232c'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_uvsurv <- trial |> select(age, grade, death, ttdeath) |> tbl_uvregression( method = coxph, y = Surv(ttdeath, death), exponentiate = TRUE ) |> add_global_p() tbl_uvsurv ```
Characteristic N HR1 95% CI1 p-value
Age 189 1.01 0.99, 1.02 0.3
Grade 200 0.075
I — —
II 1.28 0.80, 2.05
III 1.69 1.07, 2.66
1 HR = Hazard Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} A **multivariable** table: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-23_e6e60c0c32ccf6725e10dd536908e70a'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_mvsurv <- coxph( Surv(ttdeath, death) ~ age + grade, data = trial ) |> tbl_regression( exponentiate = TRUE ) |> add_global_p() tbl_mvsurv ```
Characteristic HR1 95% CI1 p-value
Age 1.01 0.99, 1.02 0.3
Grade 0.041
I — —
II 1.20 0.73, 1.97
III 1.80 1.13, 2.87
1 HR = Hazard Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
::: ::: ::: ## tbl_merge() for side-by-side tables ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-24_cd1560531c186fd1a5d534d92da14b93'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_merge( list(tbl_uvsurv, tbl_mvsurv), tab_spanner = c("**Univariable**", "**Multivariable**") ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Characteristic Univariable Multivariable
N HR1 95% CI1 p-value HR1 95% CI1 p-value
Age 189 1.01 0.99, 1.02 0.3 1.01 0.99, 1.02 0.3
Grade 200 0.075 0.041
I — — — —
II 1.28 0.80, 2.05 1.20 0.73, 1.97
III 1.69 1.07, 2.66 1.80 1.13, 2.87
1 HR = Hazard Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
``` ::: ::: ## tbl_stack() to combine vertically ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} A **univariable** table: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-25_209de4790dc557793def82793f87a066'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_uvsurv2 <- coxph(Surv(ttdeath, death) ~ trt, data = trial) |> tbl_regression( show_single_row = trt, label = trt ~ "Drug B vs A", exponentiate = TRUE ) tbl_uvsurv2 ```
Characteristic HR1 95% CI1 p-value
Drug B vs A 1.25 0.86, 1.81 0.2
1 HR = Hazard Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} A **multivariable** table: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-26_0e063fb212d2267de6eb6b7a13329b36'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl_mvsurv2 <- coxph(Surv(ttdeath, death) ~ trt + grade + stage + marker, data = trial) |> tbl_regression( show_single_row = trt, label = trt ~ "Drug B vs A", exponentiate = TRUE, include = "trt" ) tbl_mvsurv2 ```
Characteristic HR1 95% CI1 p-value
Drug B vs A 1.30 0.88, 1.92 0.2
1 HR = Hazard Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
::: ::: ::: ## tbl_stack() to combine vertically ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-27_a5ba52ebed45d091abcef483beeb063d'} ```{.r .cell-code} list(tbl_uvsurv2, tbl_mvsurv2) |> tbl_stack( group_header = c("Unadjusted", "Adjusted") ) ```
Characteristic HR1 95% CI1 p-value
Unadjusted
Drug B vs A 1.25 0.86, 1.81 0.2
Adjusted
Drug B vs A 1.30 0.88, 1.92 0.2
1 HR = Hazard Ratio, CI = Confidence Interval
::: ## tbl_strata() for stratified tables ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-28_69268a8e55de49f5fc0c6bf6e405dc68'} ```{.r .cell-code} sm_trial |> mutate(grade = paste("Grade", grade)) |> tbl_strata( strata = grade, ~tbl_summary(.x, by = trt, missing = "no") |> modify_header(all_stat_cols() ~ "**{level}**") ) ```
Characteristic Grade I Grade II Grade III
Drug A1 Drug B1 Drug A1 Drug B1 Drug A1 Drug B1
Age 46 (36, 60) 48 (42, 55) 44 (31, 54) 50 (43, 57) 52 (42, 60) 45 (36, 52)
Tumor Response 8 (23%) 13 (41%) 7 (23%) 12 (36%) 13 (43%) 8 (24%)
1 Median (IQR); n (%)
::: ## Define custom function `tbl_cmh()`

## Define custom function `tbl_cmh()`

## {gtreg} for regulatory submissions * The {gtreg} package uses {gtsummary} to construct tables for regulatory agencies. * [https://shannonpileggi.github.io/gtreg/](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/gtreg/) ::: {.cell output-location='slide' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-29_cdae56178092b5ccb340759e7d0de5bb'} ```{.r .cell-code} gtreg::df_adverse_events |> gtreg::tbl_ae( id_df = gtreg::df_patient_characteristics, id = patient_id, ae = adverse_event, soc = system_organ_class, by = grade, strata = trt ) |> modify_header(gtreg::all_ae_cols() ~ "**Grade {by}**") |> bold_labels() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: # {gtsummary} themes ## {gtsummary} theme basics - A **theme** is a set of customization preferences that can be easily set and reused. - Themes control **default settings for existing functions** - Themes control more **fine-grained customization** not available via arguments or helper functions - Easily use one of the **available themes**, or **create your own** ## {gtsummary} default theme ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-30_9eb6260f30d5b927132a1772c4765147'} ```{.r .cell-code} reset_gtsummary_theme() m1 |> tbl_regression( exponentiate = TRUE ) |> modify_caption( "Default Theme" ) ```

::: *Reduces padding and font size* ## {gtsummary} set_gtsummary_theme() * `set_gtsummary_theme()` to use a custom theme. * See the {gtsummary} + themes vignette for examples http://www.danieldsjoberg.com/gtsummary/articles/themes.html # {gtsummary} print engines ## {gtsummary} print engines ![](images/gtsummary_rmarkdown.png) ## {gtsummary} print engines Use any print engine to customize table ::: {.cell output-location='column' hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-34_746783303a3bbfc347bfdccfdf168e1b'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="1,5,6,7,8"} library(gt) trial |> select(age, grade) |> tbl_summary() |> as_gt() |> cols_width(label ~ px(300)) |> cols_align(columns = stat_0, align = "left") ```

::: # In Closing ## {gtsummary} website [http://www.danieldsjoberg.com/gtsummary/](http://www.danieldsjoberg.com/gtsummary/) ```{=html} ``` ## {gtsummary} installation ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%" } Install production version from CRAN: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-35_3e1f650ac25fb891d4d4107a1f0f6f8e'} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages("gtsummary") ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} Install development version from GitHub: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-36_1d9b2c7d7e8331ef766b94e7e2e4d656'} ```{.r .cell-code} remotes::install_github("ddsjoberg/gtsummary") ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-37_f8828c10750d60d9f94f6ab17b7f1b4a'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-37-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## {gtsummary} sandbox in {bstfun} [http://www.danieldsjoberg.com/bstfun/](http://www.danieldsjoberg.com/bstfun/) ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%" } ![](images/bstfun_website.jpg) ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](images/add_sparkline_ex1.png) ![](images/add_inline_forest_plot_ex1.png) ::: ::: ## Thank you ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ddsjoberg/gtsummary/main/data-raw/misc_files/tbl_summary_demo_fast.gif) ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ``{=html} Ask on [stackoverflow.com](stackoverflow.com) ``{=html} *Use the gtsummary tag* ``{=html} Hundreds of Qs already answered! ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ``{=html} [danieldsjoberg.com](https://www.danieldsjoberg.com/) ``{=html} [\@statistishdan](https://twitter.com/statistishdan) ``{=html} [linkedin.com/in/ddsjoberg/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ddsjoberg/) ``{=html} [github.com/ddsjoberg](https://github.com/ddsjoberg/) ::: :::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {

      // dispatch for htmlwidgets
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for reveal
    if (window.Reveal) {
      window.Reveal.addEventListener("slidechanged", function(event) {
        fireSlideChanged(event.previousSlide, event.currentSlide);
      });
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
